coffees.name: Drip
coffees.fact: Has more caffeine than one shot of espresso! A single shot of espresso has about 100 milligrams of caffeine and a cup of coffee has 128 milligrams of caffeine.

coffees.name: Cold Brew
coffees.fact: Is about 67% less acidic than a regular cup of coffee and is sweeter.

coffees.name: Espresso
coffees.fact: Is regulated by the Italian government because it is considered an essential part of their daily life.

coffees.name: Latte
coffees.fact: Its name is derived from the Italian phrase Caffe Latte, which means milk coffee. If you order a latte in Italy, you would only get a glass of milk

coffees.name: Macchiato
coffees.fact: Created to show servers the difference between an espresso, and an espresso with a tiny bit of milk.

coffees.name: Americano
coffees.fact: Created by Americans stationed in Italy during WWII, who tried to recreate Drip coffee from back home

coffees.name: Instant Coffee
coffees.fact: Makes 13% of all coffee consumed worldwide.

coffees.name: Madras Coffee
coffees.fact: Has chicory in it, giving it a very unique flavor renowned in India.

coffees.name: Irish Coffee
coffees.fact: Joe Sheridan, a chef at the airport in Foynes, Ireland, added Irish Whiskey to the coffees of American passengers whose flights were delayed due to bad weather to warm them up.
